message.content:
cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.PL, cs.DS, cs.CC

The paper deals with the undecidability of a language preservation problem for a subclass of timed automata called parametric event-recording automata (PERAs). This problem is related to the theory of formal languages and automata, which falls under the category of logic in computer science (cs.LO). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of finite sequences of actions and accepting locations, which are concepts related to formal languages and automata, and hence, the paper could also be classified under the categories of formal languages and automata (cs.FL), programming languages (cs.PL), distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DS), and computational complexity (cs.CC).
